definition: an essay in eight parts/stereotyped writing
eight/8

thigh/part of a whole/portion of a sum/(stock) share/strand of a thread/low-level administrative unit, translated as "section" or "department" etc, ranked below 科[ke1]/classifier for long winding things like ropes, rivers etc/classifier for smoke, smells etc: thread, puff, whiff/classifier for bands of people, gangs etc/classifier for sudden forceful actions
eight-part essay one had to master to pass the imperial exams in Ming and Qing dynasties
drab, stereotypical Communist Party writing style

sentences.english: Baguwen ( Stereotyped Writing) can be classified into two categories: Dati (Broad-theme) and Xiaoti (Narrow-theme).
sentences.chinese: 八股文可以分为大题和小题两类。

sentences.english: I think mainly when taking a disability from the eight-legged essay in the examination system to explore.
sentences.chinese: 我以为主要当从八股文取士的科举制度中去探寻。

sentences.english: The Eight-part essay was one of the special styles for the Imperial Examination from Ming to Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 八股文是明清科举考试最基本也是最重要的一种文体。

sentences.english: The abolition of foreign stereotypes was demanded in that report, yet some comrades are still promoting them.
sentences.chinese: 这里叫洋八股废止，有些同志却实际上还在提倡。

sentences.english: The weak points of the imperial examination system cannot be regarded as the reason for negative rationality of the Eight - part Essay stylistic style.
sentences.chinese: 科举制度的弊端不能成为否定八股文体合理性的理由。

sentences.english: "QingZhengYaZheng" is the marking criterion for the Eight-part Essay of the Imperial examination in Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: “清真雅正”是清代科举八股文的衡文标准。

sentences.english: And those who produce stereotyped Party writing always seek large audiences.
sentences.chinese: 而写党八股的人们，却总是想写给许多人看的。

sentences.english: Although the content of "eight part essay" is timeworn, the form and layout can be used for reference.
sentences.chinese: 内容陈旧的八股文，其布局形式未尝不可借鉴。

sentences.english: "Ba-Jiao (Eight-foot) Ci", is a rarely-known name of the stereotyped writing in the Ming Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 八脚词是明代八股文一种少为人知的异称。

definition: eight-part essay one had to master to pass the imperial exams in Ming and Qing dynasties
essay on current affairs submitted to the emperor as policy advice (old)
old language/the Classics/Classical Chinese as a literary model, esp. in Tang and Song prose/Classical Chinese as a school subject
imperial examination
parallel prose (ancient literary style)
old learning/Chinese traditional teaching as opposed to material from the West
study of the Confucian classics
poetry and prose/rhetoric
grammar
Former Han dynasty school of Confucian scholars
parallel (sentences)/parallel prose
preparatory literary studies for imperial examination
pedant/old fogey
Confucian scholar (old)
to interpret and make glossaries and commentaries on classic texts
writings in the vernacular
